active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate how human error in security incidents (e.g., phishing susceptibility) links to training gaps. Using NIST SP 800-50, propose how gap analysis can mitigate these risks and share real-world examples from recent breaches.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Security Training Gap Analysis (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Risk Management Concepts > Personnel and Human Risk Management > Security Awareness and Training Risk > Security Training Gap Analysis). ## Full Research Context A security training gap analysis identifies discrepancies between current workforce cybersecurity competencies and required levels to mitigate risks. Key Concepts: Security Training Gap (current vs. required competencies); Awareness (recognize risks); Training (job skills); Role-Based Training; Competency (KSAs/TKS). Frameworks: - NIST SP 800-50 Rev. 1 'Building an Effective Cybersecurity Awareness and Training Program' (https://doi.org/10.6028/NIST.SP.800-50r1): Lifecycle - Plan/Organize, Analyze/Design, Develop/Implement, Evaluate/Improve. - NICE Framework (NIST SP 800-181, https://www.nist.gov/itl/applied-cybersecurity/nice): TKS for roles; aligns with 'Federal Cybersecurity Role Description Catalog' concepts. - NIST SP 800-53 AT controls. Sources: NIST site, Verizon DBIR (human factors). Use these Learning Objectives [paste array], Active Learning [reference for inspiration], Scaffolding Layers [paste full scaffolding], and Flashcard Schema exactly. Generate 30 high-quality flashcards (balanced by Bloom's and layers). Output as JSON array: [{type, question, answer, explanation, distractors (if MC), bloom_level, scaffolding_layer, related_concepts}]. Ensure university-level pedagogy: active recall, spaced repetition friendly, no hints in questions.
